content: User <1>{{email}}</1> is already registered in this {{productName}}, enter your password or go back to continue with another email.

comment.text: This translation key displays a message when a user tries to register with an email that is already associated with their account. The message informs the user of the existing registration and provides options to enter their password or cancel the process. It appears on the login form when trying to register via invitation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are not properly closed in the Arabic translation. They should either be removed or the content within should be more accurately rendered.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags or ensure they accurately reflect the intended styling/formatting. Consider if the angle brackets are necessary in the Arabic context. If not, remove them. If they are needed, confirm the proper rendering in the final product.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'istifadəçisi' (user) is unnecessary and adds awkwardness. It's implied that the email address belongs to a user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Artıq bu {{productName}}-də qeydiyyatdan keçmişdir <1>{{email}}</1>, parolunuzu daxil edin və ya başqa e-poçtla davam etmək üçün geri qayıdın.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of 'istifadəçisi' disrupts the flow of the sentence and its connection to the original structure. It is better to reflect the original sentence structure.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Artıq bu {{productName}}-də qeydiyyatdan keçmişdir <1>{{email}}</1>, parolunuzu daxil edin və ya başqa e-poçtla davam etmək üçün geri qayıdın.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation maintains the angle brackets `<1>{{email}}</1>` which are present in the English content. This is unusual and may be a placeholder that needs review or removal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review if the angle brackets are necessary. If not, remove them. If they are placeholders, ensure the translation team understands their purpose and handles them accordingly.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon in "{{productName}}:een" is not standard Finnish punctuation when indicating location or belonging. It's more common to use a 'in' or 'on'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Käyttäjä <1>{{email}}</1> on jo rekisteröity {{productName}}iin, syötä salasanasi tai palaa jatkaaksesi toisella sähköpostilla.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The email variable `<1>{{email}}</1>` is not properly formatted. It uses `<1>` and `</1>` which is inconsistent with typical variable formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Use a standard variable format, such as `<1>{{email}}</1>` or `<email>{{email}}</email>` depending on the system's requirements.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation retains the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` which are unnecessary and disrupt the readability of the sentence. They should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the `<1>` and `</1>` tags from the Armenian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'go back to continue with another email' is somewhat awkwardly translated. It implies continuing *with* another email, which is unusual. A more natural phrasing is needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing 'վերադարձեք՝ շարունակելու մեկ այլ էլ' to something like 'վերադարձեք և օգտագործեք մեկ այլ էլեկտրոնային հասցե' (return and use another email address) or a similar phrasing that more naturally conveys the intended meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Japanese translation, mirroring the English. While technically correct in representing the tag, they disrupt the natural flow and readability of the Japanese sentence. They should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ユーザー{{email}}はすでにこの{{productName}}に登録されています。パスワードを入力するか、前に戻って別のメールアドレスでログインしてください。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "돌아가서 다른 이메일로 계속 진행하세요" is slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing might be "다른 이메일 주소로 진행하시거나 돌아가세요." or "다른 이메일 주소를 사용하시거나 돌아가세요."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 다른 이메일 주소를 사용하시거나 돌아가세요.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "go back to continue with another email" is not the most natural way to express this in Lao. A more natural phrasing would be something closer to 'ຫຼືກັບຄືນໄປໃຊ້ອີເມວອື່ນ' (or go back to use another email).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຫຼືກັບຄືນໄປໃຊ້ອີເມວອື່ນ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "go back" is too literal. A more natural Dutch phrasing would be "ga terug" or “keer terug”.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Gebruiker <1>{{email}}</1> is al geregistreerd in deze {{productName}}, voer uw wachtwoord in of keer terug om verder te gaan met een andere e-mail.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'enter' (voer) is slightly awkward in this context. 'Vul in' might be a more natural choice.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Gebruiker <1>{{email}}</1> is al geregistreerd in deze {{productName}}, vul uw wachtwoord in of keer terug om verder te gaan met een andere e-mail.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variable `{{productName}}` is not enclosed in angle brackets like `{{email}}`. It should be `<1>{{productName}}</1>` to maintain consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change `{{productName}}` to `<1>{{productName}}</1>`

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation maintains the <1> and </1> tags from the English content. These tags are likely intended for formatting and should be verified to ensure they are applied correctly within the application's UI and aren't just literal text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirm that the <1> and </1> tags are being rendered correctly in the UI and are necessary. If they are just literal text, remove them.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'introduceţi parola dvs' is grammatically correct, but a slightly more natural phrasing could be considered.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'introduceți parola dumneavoastră' or 'introduceți parola' for a more flowing and natural tone. The original is acceptable, though.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "පරිශීලක" (parishilaka) translates to 'user' but is an uncommon or slightly formal term. A more natural and common word for 'user' in this context would be 'වියත්කරුවා' (viyathkaruwa) or simply 'භාවිතකරු' (pavitha karuru).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'පරිශීලක' with 'වියත්කරුවා' or 'භාවිතකරු'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "මෙම {{productName}} හි" (meha {{productName}} hi) is a bit awkward. It translates to 'in this {{productName}}'. A more fluent phrasing would be something like '{{productName}} තුල' ({{productName}} thula).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'මෙම {{productName}} හි' with '{{productName}} තුල'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure could be improved for better flow.  The current translation is somewhat literal. It could be restructured to be more natural in Sinhala.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider restructuring the sentence to flow more naturally in Sinhala. For instance: "{{productName}} තුල, <1>{{email}}</1> පරිශීලකයා දැනටමත් ලියාපදිංචි වී ඇත. මුරපදය ඇතුළත් කරන්න, නැවතත් ప్రయత్నించండి හෝ වෙනත් విద‍్యුත් තැපෑලක් භාවිතించి కొనసాగන්න." ({{productName}} thula, <1>{{email}}</1> parishilakaaya danaithaam liyaapadiunchi veetha. Murapadaya ethulath kannela, nethaath prayaanthinaala hor venaath vidyuth thapaalaka vibhayangi konaasaganna.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation of 'in this product' ('v tomto priestore') is inaccurate. 'Priestor' translates to 'space' or 'area,' which doesn't convey the intended meaning of a product or service.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Používateľ <1>{{email}}</1> je už zaregistrovaný v tomto {{productName}}, zadajte svoje heslo alebo sa vráťte späť a pokračujte s iným e-mailom.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'zadajte' can be a little too formal for this context.  A more conversational word might be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Používateľ <1>{{email}}</1> je už zaregistrovaný v tomto {{productName}}, vložte svoje heslo alebo sa vráťte späť a pokračujte s iným e-mailom.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'prostoru' (space) doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'product' in this context. It implies a physical space instead of a service or application.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Uporabnik <1>{{email}}</1> je že registriran v tem {{productName}}. (or) Uporabnik <1>{{email}}</1> je že registriran v tem izdelku {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English content. They are used in both, but the Slovenian translation uses 'prostoru' where the English uses the variable. While technically not an error, it might be an issue.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Check to ensure the tags are appropriately matched in both English and Slovenian.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets around 'email' should match the English content. Serbian translation uses Cyrillic angle brackets, while the English uses standard brackets.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change `<1>{{email}}</1>` to `<1>{{email}}</1>`

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'email' is directly transliterated as 'емаил-ом'. It would be more natural to use a Serbian equivalent like 'e-mail' or 'адресу е-поште'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'емаил-ом' with 'e-mail' or 'адресу е-поште'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The hyphen in 'productName'-u seems unnecessary. It's creating an awkward construction.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Korisnik <1>{{email}}</1> je već registrovan u ovom {{productName}}, unesite svoju lozinku ili se vratite da biste nastavili sa drugim email-om.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are not translated. They should remain as is in the Turkish translation to preserve the intended formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the tags `<1>` and `</1>` are not translated and are maintained in the Turkish translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'просторі' (prostori) translates to 'space' or 'area', which doesn't accurately reflect the intended meaning of 'in this {{productName}}'. It should convey that the user is already registered within a specific product or service.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Користувач <1>{{email}}</1> вже зареєстрований у цьому продукті {{productName}}. (Korystuvach <1>{{email}}</1> vzhe zareiestrovanyi u ts’omu produktsi {{productName}}.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1> and </1> are not standard or common in Ukrainian text. They are likely placeholders from the English content and should be removed unless they serve a specific purpose in the system.  If they represent a specific formatting instruction (like bolding), the Ukrainian translation should reflect that with proper Ukrainian formatting.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Користувач {{email}} вже зареєстрований у цьому продукті {{productName}}. Введіть свій пароль або поверніться й продовжте з іншою адресою електронної пошти.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are not correctly closed in Vietnamese. They are present but need to be consistent. The English original uses `<1>{{email}}</1>`, and the Vietnamese should mirror this.  There is no apparent functional reason for the brackets; they likely indicate formatting, so consistent handling is crucial.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Người dùng <1>{{email}}</1> đã được đăng ký trong {{productName}} này, hãy nhập mật khẩu của bạn hoặc quay lại để tiếp tục với một email khác.
